intro: Coelopleurum gmelinii, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Coelopleurum gmelinii is often used in rock gardens and alpine landscapes due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
